page.title: 12Houses and Buildings
page.content: There are approximately 97 houses and farms in the area being surveyed. There is no stone nearby apart from chalk with the result that the oldest buildings, apart from the church, were erected about 200 years ago. The oldest farmhouses are Georgian but most were built between 100 and 200 years ago. Farm buildings adjacent to the farms are now out of date and being replaced by steel and asbestos. In the village the predominant style is semi-detached, the best quality being those erected in the 1900's. Garton is not a development village so there are very few new houses. All the houses are made of bricks, either made locally or machine made. Roofing materials consist of boxhill tiles, concrete tiles and slate.
